DOC.HEAD: Summary of Events
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Here is a brief summary of events Sunday in Romania: _The revolutionary government called for a cease-fire as citizens and soldiers allied with them fought secret police loyal to ousted dictator Nicolae Ceausescu. Sniper fire paralyzed Bucharest and bodies piled up in morgues. _Vigilante groups plucked weapons from dead soldiers and sought revenge against the fallen regime's supporters. _Four Western journalists, including Associated Press correspondent John Daniszewski, were shot and wounded while covering the fierce fighting in the western city of Timisoara. _Revolutionary soldiers found a vast labyrinth of safe houses and tunnels used by police forces loyal to Ceausescu. _The United States and France said they would not oppose Soviet bloc military intervention in Romania. _France also said it is willing to help muster a ``brigade of volunteers'' if asked to aid the Romanian insurgency. _The International Red Cross led new efforts to send in food and medical aid, but the fighting prevented most relief flights from landing in Bucharest. _Romanians who long suffered religious oppression play Christmas music throughout the country for the first time in 42 years.
